flavourText: The mournful music of the strings,
The creaking arch, the arrow sings.
A choking cry, a rattled breath,
The Reaper's Song, the Harp of Death.

items.descrText: Place into an allocated Jewel Socket on the Passive Skill Tree. Right click to remove from the Socket.

flavourText: Some gifts are obligations while others are simply opportunities.
"How many lives have you consumed?"
"How many times have you blinked?"
His brother would not atone, so he took his brother's life, and with it, his sins.
Lethal, untouchable, keen, aflame. Just what I was looking for.
<size:30>{A weapon, a shelter, a prison.
The web's purpose changes
with the spider's needs.
A lesson we should
take to heart.}
<size:28>{A ravenous mind can readily take in ideas from any source.
Fortunately for the scholars, he has already learned about sustainability.}
They say it is the head that leads, but all must flow through the body at some point.
<size:31>{"Daughter of catastrophe, mother of pain. Amongst the filth of Wraeclast, she wanders, and her wrath follows." - Quintoon the Returned}
Taste and grow strong. Drink too much and be buried.
The jeweller's true talent is the capacity to see a jewel's beauty before they draw it out.
Wealth can, in fact, buy happiness.
The Poet's blood is the Empire's ink.
"I'm going for a walk. I'll be back soon."
- Blonca's last words
To her beauty you submit,
lest your neck the great Queen slit.
Lucian lost himself in ancient scrolls and found in those scrolls a love whose power bridged a millennium.
On the 21st of Eterni,
two become one,
their light outshines
the setting sun.
Beware the sudden calm, for it is a sure sign of a storm on the horizon.
<size:26>{Many were slain by the sword king
Their blood decorating his ring
Those who retreated were slaughtered
Those who fought bravely were honoured}
For every threat you spy in the shadows, there are two others you don't.
It is with the smallest of words that we find the largest of truths.
"Experiment 22A: Rhoas, when deprived of water, secrete a most delightfully potent toxin."
- Maligaro
"When grasped in his hand, even an ordinary piece of wood can make the heavens tremble with fear."
When the dead raise and master their own, the land is truly lost.
Some powers are far too great even for the
gods of old.
The mind had much to endure before the advent of thaumaturgy.
<size:30>{"Let us not forget the most important lesson the Vaal taught us:
Nothing is eternal."
- Siosa Foaga, Imperial Scholar}
Even the most learned man is a fool to his own fate.
<size:31>{There is no mistake so great that it cannot be undone.}
I've never come upon a ship I could not command. I have however met sailors that were not willing to be led.
If you beckon the
Lord of Lightning,
do not be surprised
when you are struck.
<size:27>{"There are worlds that lie beyond the edge of my page, the edge of my understanding. Worlds of wonder. Worlds of terror."
Aramil - Cartographer to Emperor Chitus}
"This one? It is NOT for sale. You would sooner pry it from my lifeless hand."
- Jonfé Darontos, Ringmaker
"Don't worry, I know what I'm doing."
- Toggo's Last Words
<size:31>{Each night, the light dies, and each morning she is born anew, embracing the land in her golden wings.}
<size:34>{He dispels dark realms
until mortal sufferings
yield to hopeful light.}
<size:24>{Dread and danger
makes the air feel thin.
Above, power slumbers, tempting fate.
Greed and ambition
draws countless in,
For those who seek power
can never wait.}
<size:31>{Born of relentless fury and abhorrence, warped by turmoil and anguish, tainted through desire and carnality, I thirst for bloodshed once more.}
<size:28>{I gave my mind without a fight,
The twelfth hour I lost control.
The day is gone but there is light,
eyes that glow like red-hot coal.}
Never dying, yet not living,
Endlessly they wander
beneath the harvest moon.
"Many believe murder is a grisly, grim, and grotesque crime. Then there are those who simply make art of it."
Sometimes you need to make your own luck.
No man may hope to turn back the storm. You can only hope you do not attract its ire.
Take small pieces of things and then assemble them together
<size:30>{Taste not of their
forbidden fruit.
Theirs is a harvest of
the darkest kind,
twisted, rotten and
damned for eternity.}
Claw them from the bottom, you'll be glad that you have got 'em, claw them from the top, you'll never want to stop.
Lioneye looked to the heights of glorious victory. And thus he missed the defeat right under his nose.
Embrace the Light,
Await the Morrow,
No more Spite,
And no more Sorrow.
By the time their eyes meet,
the dark deal has long since been made,
and his fate long since sealed.
"Some see our mortal flesh as a limitation. I see it as an opportunity for vast, miraculous improvements."
- Shavronne of Umbra
<size:27>{A jolt, and it moves. Or smolders.
A current, and it lives. Or dies.
A surge, and it transcends.
Or... not.
Only one way to find out.}
<size:32>{Blood flows not just through veins, but through worlds.}
"Only after one forsakes rage, can true power be found."
- Sekhema Asenath
A life lost, A legacy born.
"Only a fool looks to the occult for power and expects to be spared from its wrath."
- Voll, Emperor of Purity
A tower built of the strongest stone is not eternal; a towering intellect is not enlightened.
The flesh is a prison, and we are finally free.
"Hold your tongue before I claim it." - Doedre Darktongue
Accumulating wealth has its own costs.
As countless fractures weaken the divide, nightmares seep through from the other side.
"No man can best me, no demon can fell me. For I vanquish all with my axe!"
Perfection is the standard, excellence will be handled on a case by case basis.
The academic route to knowledge is wide and well-trodden; but it is the untaught one who scales the mountain.
To own a piece of the Nightmare, you must first belong to the Nightmare.
A map is only useful if you know where you stand.
Though they were a pack of elite combatants, the Emperor's royal guards were not ready to face one of his notorious parties.
"I don't believe in karma. If it were real, I would never win."
<size:28>{Scaly beast of the skies,
watching with his golden eyes.
Shadow that blocks out the sun,
it's too late for you to run.}
<size:28>{Charmed by beautiful stones
Consumed with the
pursuit of perfection
Ever deeper into the waiting dark}
"Masters of wit, strength and cunning. To survive the harsh winters, you must be like the fox."
- Ezomyte Proverb
<size:28>{You can't seek riches without getting your hands dirty.}
<size:27>{A wanderer in the wild strives
Against countless foes he survives
A fool pursues a quest contrived
By the gift of the witch, alive.}
Though the path to divinity is fraught with peril, hope may bloom from within.
Our world, dangerous as it is, is far safer than what lies just beyond our sight.
To know the monster, you must become the monster.
Luck is a fool's game, and I know plenty of rich fools.
An oath once made is an oath never broken. Do not delay in keeping it, for I take no pleasure in fools.
<size:30>{Many that have wielded the power of lightning have said that death by electrocution looks like the victim is more alive than ever before.}
The earth offers nourishment, growth and healing. Unless, of course, the sky has other plans.
Simple actions can lead the world to an early grave.
Jump right in,
But beware
Of things broken
Or beyond compare.
Unlimited power is apt to corrupt the minds of those who possess it.
Before gemlings, before thaumaturgy, a simple court magician could enthrall the masses.
From death, life.
From life, death.
The wheel turns,
and the corbies wheel overhead.
Exploring lands made of flesh and sorrow, we'll reap and plunder like there's no tomorrow.
Scarier than any criminal is an innocent man in chains, for when he breaks free, his revenge will be justified.
<size:31>{500 times Kaom's axe fell, 500 times Kaom's Heart splintered. Finally, all that remained was a terrible, heartless Fury.}
We play at God with our necromancy,
but forces far more potent
sleep within these stones.
Those whose hands are their livelihood know the importance of keeping them safe and warm.
"In the forest again... But at least I have these."
A lucky number
For us all
To help us through
The perils told.
<size:31>{As their civilisation crumbled, the Vaal looked to their queen. In her, they saw a way out. In them, she saw a burden she was happy to free herself from.}
Our Lady Dialla,
as a symbol of our progress,
shines greater than all the gems.
The thumb turns down
and the crowd roars,
they want death
and the blood is yours.
Trying to bring your vision to life is enough to drive you mad.
Justice comes swift
Equal to the crime
Revenge is a gift
Life for a life
Eye for an eye

<size:26>{"I wanted to give you three things. I've given you my eternal love. I've sung to you my most beautiful song. I'd have given you the moon last, but it couldn't be found. I hope you'll accept this instead."}
<size:29>{Three men travel
through the gate;
they carry a protective ward.
A faction conspires
against their fate,
but magic unravels the sword.}
All dreams vanish when the dreamers wake.
<size:27>{Fire filled the sky that night
Chaos reigned
Where the shards fell
All was destroyed
-Jozen Kasigi, retelling an urban legend of the Cataclysm}
The path to godhood is guided by the hand of sacrifice.
Discovery can lead to beauty, or it can lead to ruin.
The village elders had a curious rule: If you hear three voices scream for aid, flee as fast as you can.
In combat, a warrior must first be resourceful,
and second, decisive.
Turn the crank,
close your eyes,
and pray to the gods
for a pleasant surprise.
<size:27>{The mighty warriors traded in blows, the nimble archers in arrows, yet it was the brazen thaumaturgists who would bring catastrophe to all.}
"The most valuable treasures should be hidden in plain sight."
- Ina, Keeper of Goods
<size:31>{A month's work, a year's wages, a foolish shortcut through a Rhoa's nest, and a grieving bride-to-be, who never received her betrothed's great gift.}
<size:28>{A map is similar
to a pair of eyes,
without one you stumble
around, unable to find your way.}
If you wish to rush into strange places, be prepared to face strange things.
In the hands of a master craftsman, a worthless pebble can adorn the crown of a king.
With staff in hand
and wrath in heart,
your soul and corpse
shall surely part.
Whoever said 'more is always better' has obviously never met a rat.
Boundless is the distance between where we start and where we start again.
Primed, curved and sleek.
Decisive and final.
For malice and righteousness.
There's but one solution.
Sturdy and strong,
grown from the stream.
The Flora that live here,
A combatant's dream.
Bound by fate,
inseparable by choice.
<size:29>{A mind as quick as lightning,
fists as hard as stone,
a heart that burns with fury,
and eyes that chill to the bone.}
Oh the places you will go, the sights you will see, the things you will meet.
The howls and cackling could not mask the sadness.
Her beauty did not fade
her humanity did not survive.
You can change your name, but you cannot change your history.
"Axes and mauls are so uncivilised. A good clean cut to the neck with a sharp blade, that's the Sarn way!"
<size:31>{Strange eyes on top of spines
Gaze beyond the veil of time
Deep down below the mines
A dream of crimson and of grime}
A king's movement is unwavering.
"He might be lacking in vision, but his virtuosity is undeniable."
- Malachai, on Maligaro
"Sometimes, the most beautiful treasures...are the ones you cannot have."
- Beryl, Survivor from the Azurite Mines
Their whims left unknown,
Their life left for others.
Maligaro may have valued function over form, but that did not mute his flair for the dramatic.
<size:31>{The end of the old,
the beginning of the new.
A unique opportunity for transformation,
for those with the power
to grasp it.}
They stand among us, and within us.
"On this day I mark the first of many agreements that I will have with this land and its people."
The first quill separates the quick learners from the dead.
'Lightning never strikes the same place twice'
is really just wishful thinking.
A taste of power brings a hunger for more.
<size:31>{Brutus' first innovation as Lord Incarcerator was a weighted chain around every neck so that his prisoners would forever bow to him.}
They whose lives were given to clothe the Dark Dreamer... They were the lucky ones.
When the darkness weighs upon you, grow light from within.
No matter where your dreams take you, Nightmare follows close behind.
Shame what happened to my husband. He had such good taste.
"The Karui was correct; there is virtue in honouring my ancestors."
<size:28>{First, I gave my wealth, and we went hungry. Next, I gave my land, and we were homeless. Then, I gave my family, and I was alone. Last, I gave my eyes, and all I could dream was mine.}
Two sides of a coin;
Heads for a friend,
tails a foe;
Gemini toss up
When there is no other choice, even the meekest whisper can bring about the greatest storm.
When the outcome is the same, does it matter if it is fortune or trickery?
The house always wins.
<size:28>{A symbol of beauty and innocence
The gems corrupted her mind
Malachai corrupted her gems
All but a glimmer of
greatness lost in madness}
In the prison of all sins, will you grasp godhood or sorrow? Only hope lies under the shadows.
<smaller>{They fought the storm together as one,
Until the longest of days was done.
Their love grew stronger
with every breath,
Until it was broken apart in death.}
The hermit's only friend is the greenery he can find.
<size:28>{The hatungo know many answers to the same question,
for time itself is a tangled web.}

items.name: Crown of Thorns
explicitMods: Reflects 5 Physical Damage to Melee Attackers
+5 Physical Damage taken from Attack Hits
flavourText: Lift it lightly, don it slow.
The spikes point out and in, you know.

items.name: Fairgraves' Tricorne
explicitMods: Adds 6 to 12 Cold Damage to Attacks
flavourText: Fairgraves' trusty tricorne accompanied him far across
the seas, deep under the ground, and even beyond death.

items.name: Gorgon's Gaze
explicitMods: 5% additional Physical Damage Reduction while moving
5% reduced Elemental Damage taken while stationary
flavourText: Men always fell for her honeyed eyes,
and broke when they hit the ground.

items.name: The Three Dragons
explicitMods: Your Fire Damage can Shock but not Ignite
Your Cold Damage can Ignite but not Freeze or Chill
Your Lightning Damage can Freeze but not Shock
flavourText: "The ice seared his naked feet
As the lightning stilled his heart,
But it was the flames upon his lover's face
That roused him to vengeance."
- From 'The Three Dragons' by Victario of Sarn

items.name: Skullhead
explicitMods: Minions have +10% Chance to Block Attack Damage
Minions Regenerate 2% of Life per second
flavourText: All that was left of the Iron King was his bleached skull.
Yet it was all the Iron King needed.

items.name: Rime Gaze
explicitMods: Socketed Gems are Supported by Level 20 Concentrated Effect
+22% to Cold Damage over Time Multiplier
flavourText: The malice in her gaze froze blood and shattered bone.

items.name: Speaker's Wreath
explicitMods: 2% increased Minion Attack Speed per 50 Dexterity
2% increased Minion Movement Speed per 50 Dexterity
Minions' Hits can only Kill Ignited Enemies
flavourText: A strong pair of legs may carry you far,
but a silver tongue and a few brutes
can take you to the edge of the world.

items.name: Maw of Conquest
explicitMods: 65% increased Critical Strike Chance for Spells
11% of Damage taken gained as Life over 4 seconds when Hit
flavourText: Young Napuatzi was thrown into the pits, an unwilling sacrifice,
but the offer of her blood was refused.
She rose from the pit alive and anew.
A Leader. A Conquerer. A Viper.

items.name: Geofri's Crest
flavourText: In the battle for honour, Geofri won.
Not so, the battle for survival.

items.name: The Broken Crown
explicitMods: Socketed Gems are supported by Level 20 Cast on Death
20% increased Damage when on Low Life
flavourText: Every rule has an exception.

items.name: Starkonja's Head
explicitMods: 50% reduced Damage when on Low Life
150% increased Global Evasion Rating when on Low Life
flavourText: There was no hero made out of Starkonja's death,
but merely a long sleep made eternal.

items.name: Ahn's Contempt
explicitMods: Gain 8% of Physical Damage as Extra Chaos Damage while at maximum Power Charges
You take 50% reduced Extra Damage from Critical Strikes while you have no Power Charges
flavourText: "To touch it is to be overwhelmed with the need to carve your name into history.
A face no one remembers, yet once you have seen it, you will never forget."
- Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Item 48

items.name: Mindspiral
explicitMods: Gain 8% of Maximum Mana as Extra Maximum Energy Shield
Enemies Cannot Leech Mana From you
6% of Damage taken gained as Mana over 4 seconds when Hit
flavourText: Where top is bottom and weak is strong.

items.name: Wraithlord
explicitMods: +2 to Level of Socketed Minion Gems
Minions Regenerate 1% of Life per second
flavourText: Countless men proclaimed themselves the masters of death,
and each one succumbed to it.

items.name: Fractal Thoughts
explicitMods: +32% to Critical Strike Multiplier if Dexterity is higher than Intelligence
15% increased Dexterity if Strength is higher than Intelligence
flavourText: "The more the warrior understood Tangmazu's gift, the less the mask aided him.
His dreams were filled with divine laughter."
- Tenth Song of the Islands

items.name: Asenath's Mark
flavourText: Asenath's mind was as quick and nimble
as the fingers that drew her bowstring.

items.name: Leer Cast
explicitMods: You and nearby allies gain 15% increased Damage
flavourText: For none of us are as cruel as all of us.

items.name: Heatshiver
explicitMods: 28% increased Cold Damage if you have used a Fire Skill Recently
25% increased Fire Damage if you have used a Cold Skill Recently
flavourText: Give of your heated passions.
Give of your cold resolve.
You will be repaid.

items.name: Ezomyte Peak
flavourText: Centuries of servitude, a day
of glory, an eternity of death.

items.name: Devoto's Devotion
flavourText: Swift as thought are the actions of Man
when borne on wings of divine providence.

items.name: Doedre's Scorn
explicitMods: +2 to Level of Socketed Curse Gems
20% increased Damage with Hits and Ailments per Curse on Enemy
Curse Skills have 32% increased Skill Effect Duration
flavourText: A scar of the flesh you'll never forget,
A scar of the mind you'll never remember.

items.name: Crown of the Inward Eye
explicitMods: 15% increased maximum Life, Mana and Global Energy Shield
flavourText: Divinity is not the only path to enlightenment.
